intro: Cerastium baischanense, commonly known as the Baischan mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. Cerastium baischanense is adapted to rocky and alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
